data.title: Veterinarian In Granbury. TX 76048
data.meta_description: The staff on our team are dedicated professionals committed to the care of your pet. Please read more below to find out more about the outstanding qualifications of our staff. Pet health care is the number one reason our clients continue to bring their pets both small & large to Granbury Animal Clinic!
data.text:
DVM

Since showing pigs in 4H, Dr. Everett developed a love of animals and their care, which grew into a passion for veterinary medicine. She graduated from Texas A&M University School of Veterinary Medicine. Dr. Everett’s goal is to provide the best medicine for each patient, communicate well with each client, and for both to leave happier than when they came in. In addition, Dr. Everett is AAHA-certified in Animal Hospice and Palliative Care and is a Fear Free practitioner.

In Dr. Everett’s free time, she and her husband enjoy playing golf, traveling, discovering new restaurants, and spending time with their pets.

DVM

Dr. Bailey has always had a strong passion for animals. Therefore, she chose a career in veterinary medicine because it is constantly evolving and every day is different. She also wanted to make a difference in people and animals’ lives. She aims to establish relationships with the client and patient to provide the best advice and medicine. In addition, she is a Fear Free certified practitioner.

In Dr. Bailey’s free time, she enjoys supporting her Oklahoma State University Cowboys, traveling with her husband and son, and spending time with her fur family.

DVM

Dr. Wooton grew up in New Mexico, loving all animals, big and small. She graduated from veterinary school at Western University of Health Sciences and, with a special interest in equine medicine, completed an equine-exclusive internship. She feels fortunate to work daily to make a difference in the lives of animals and the humans who love them. She is a Fear Free Certified practitioner and is committed to providing the best patient care possible and effective client communication.

Dr. Wooton enjoys spending time with her husband and two dogs in her free time, horseback riding, hiking, and fishing. She also enjoys reading and doing crafts and hopes to one day go cage-diving with the great white sharks!!

DVM

Dr. Kevin Buchanan, affectionately called “Dr. B” by some of his clients, graduated from Oklahoma State University in 1988 with a Doctor of Veterinary Medicine degree. Dr. Buchanan began his career in Stephenville at a mixed animal practice before leaving to open his own practice in Lipan that he operated from 1989 to 2000. After selling the practice, he opened a small animal clinic in Weatherford, which he sold in 2015. Since then, he has been practicing medicine as an associate veterinarian in the metroplex. Dr. B is happy to join our practice and be much closer to his home in Weatherford, which he shares with his wife Cheli of 41 years, his son, 6 rescue dogs, 4 rescue cats and 2 rescue horses.

DVM

Dr. Naylor graduated from Texas A& M University School of Veterinary Medicine in 1978. His special interests are small animal internal medicine and llama/alpaca medicine. He joined Dr. Nunnallee and Dr. Cooper in practice in 1978, completing a trio of qualified veterinarians at Granbury Animal Clinic, and is still in practice today. Dr.Naylor was voted Best Veterinarian in Hood County for six consecutive years.

In his spare time, Dr. Naylor enjoys attending Texas A&M sporting events (especially football games), ranching, and traveling with his wife.

DVM

Dr. Rebecca ‘Becky’ Garcia grew up in the city of the 915, El Paso, TX. She developed her love of animals volunteering at animal shelters, vet clinics and a therapeutic horse-riding facility. Dr. Garcia obtained her B.S in Animal Science from Angelo State University, where she became involved in her Ag Department, furthering her interest in animal care, especially large animals. She is a graduate from Oklahoma State College of Veterinary Medicine. Her interests include reproductive work in cattle/sheep/goat and ophthalmology. Dr. Garcia has always felt the need to help her community, and helping our four-legged companions is her way of giving back. She is excited to join the GAC team and continue to do what she loves most.

In her spare time, Dr. Garcia enjoys painting and sketching, going two-stepping with her friends, and spending time with her pets at home.
